headline.print_headline: Eight Occupy Protesters Convicted of Trespassing
headline.seo: 8 Occupy Protesters Convicted of Trespassing on Trinity Church Property
headline.main: Eight Occupy Protesters Convicted of Trespassing

docs.snippet: Eight protesters with Occupy Wall Street were convicted of misdemeanor trespassing charges for entering a lot owned by a Manhattan church after their park encampment was dismantled....
docs.abstract: Eight Occupy Wall Street protesters are convicted of misdemeanor trespassing charges for entering a lot owned by Trinity Church in Manhattan after their park encampment was dismantled; seven are sentenced to community service and an eighth, who was also convicted of two other misdemeanors including attempted criminal mischief, is sentenced to 45 days in jail.
docs.lead_paragraph: Eight protesters with Occupy Wall Street were convicted of misdemeanor trespassing charges for entering a lot owned by a Manhattan church after their park encampment was dismantled.

docs.snippet: Asians have overtaken Hispanics as the largest stream of new immigrants....
docs.lead_paragraph: Asians have overtaken Hispanics as the largest stream of new immigrants.

headline.print_headline: In a Shift, Biggest Wave Of Migrants Is Now Asian
headline.seo: Asians Surpass Hispanics as Biggest Immigrant Wave
headline.main: In a Shift, Biggest Wave of Migrants Is Now Asian

docs.snippet: Asian immigrants have pushed the United States’ population of Asian descent to a record 18.2 million and helped make Asians the country’s fastest-growing racial group, a study says....
docs.abstract: Pew Research Center releases study showing that Asians have surpassed Hispanics as the largest wave of new immigrants to the United States, pushing the population of Asian descent to a record 18.2 million and helping to make Asians the fastest-growing racial group in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Asian immigrants have pushed the United States’ population of Asian descent to a record 18.2 million and helped make Asians the country’s fastest-growing racial group, a study says.

headline.print_headline: Iowa: Nuns On the Road To Protest Budget Cuts
headline.main: Iowa: Nuns on the Road to Protest Budget Cuts

docs.snippet: A group of Roman Catholic nuns has begun a nine-state bus tour protesting proposed federal budget cuts....
docs.abstract: Group of Roman Catholic nuns has begun a nine-state bus tour protesting proposed federal budget cuts, saying that they are not trying to flout recent Vatican criticism but feel called to show how Republican policies are affecting low-income families.
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of Roman Catholic nuns has begun a nine-state bus tour protesting proposed federal budget cuts.

headline.print_headline: Life and Camaraderie After the Games
headline.seo: Five U.S. Olympians Reconnect in Fun and Friendship
headline.main: Life After the Games for Five Former Olympians

docs.snippet: Jeremy Bloom, a two-time Olympic skier, began organizing monthly get-togethers with his Olympic buddies about six months ago, when he moved to Manhattan from Colorado....
docs.abstract: Former Olympic athletes Tara Lipinski, Sasha Cohen, Sarah Hughes, Jeremy Bloom and Joey Cheek, who met at the 2002 Winter games in Salt Lake City, reconnected after moving to New York City and meet regularly for casual sports activities and camaraderie.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeremy Bloom, a two-time Olympic skier, began organizing monthly get-togethers with his Olympic buddies about six months ago, when he moved to Manhattan from Colorado.

headline.print_headline: Teachers’ Union to Open Lesson-Sharing Web Site
headline.seo: Teachers’ Union to Open Lesson-Sharing Web Site
headline.main: Teachers’ Union to Open Lesson-Sharing Web Site

docs.snippet: The American Federation of Teachers has joined with a British publisher that will allow teachers to download simple work sheets or full-course outlines....
docs.abstract: American Federation of Teachers joins with the British publisher TSL Education to create a Web site, called sharemylesson.com, which will allow teachers to share curriculum materials with each other for free; site is designed to help public school teachers who are struggling to carry out new national curriculum standards amid school budget cuts.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Federation of Teachers has joined with a British publisher that will allow teachers to download simple work sheets or full-course outlines.

headline.seo: Yankees Capture 10th Straight, Longest Winning Streak Since 2005

docs.snippet: C. C. Sabathia pitched his first complete game of the season, helping the Yankees win its 10th straight, all of which have come against teams with winning records....
docs.abstract: New York Yankees win 10th game in a row, beating the Atlanta Braves, 6-2.
docs.lead_paragraph: C. C. Sabathia pitched his first complete game of the season, helping the Yankees win its 10th straight, all of which have come against teams with winning records.

headline.print_headline: University of Virginia Board Holds Firm as Anger Builds Over Ouster of President
headline.seo: University of Virginia Board Considers Sullivan Replacement
headline.main: Anger Builds Over Dismissal of University of Virginia President

docs.snippet: Thousands of students and faculty members gathered to support the university’s ousted president, Teresa Sullivan....
docs.abstract: Furor over the University of Virginia's abrupt ousting of its president, Teresa Sullivan, continues to mount as thousands of students and faculty members gather in support of her while the governing board meets to consider an interim replacement.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of students and faculty members gathered to support the university’s ousted president, Teresa Sullivan.

headline.print_headline: Lobbying Effort Is Said to Sink New Controls on Painkillers
headline.seo: Move to Restrict Painkillers Founders in Congress
headline.main: Lobbying Effort Is Said to Sink New Controls on Painkillers

docs.snippet: The measure sought to address the sharp rise in abuse of prescription drugs like hydrocodone in the last decade, but faced stiff opposition from drugstores and pharmacists....
docs.abstract: Members of Congress say that efforts to impose stricter controls on prescription drugs that are subject to rampant abuse have apparently failed after a groundswell of lobbying by pharmacists and drugstores; measure, which had been approved by Senate but was not included in House version of legislation, had sought to address the sharp rise in abuse of prescription drugs like hydrocodone in the last decade.
docs.lead_paragraph: The measure sought to address the sharp rise in abuse of prescription drugs like hydrocodone in the last decade, but faced stiff opposition from drugstores and pharmacists.

headline.print_headline: In Spirit and in Form, Ousted Titan Keeps A Hold Over Senegal
headline.seo: Abdoulaye Wade Keeps His Hold Over Senegal
headline.main: In Spirit and in Form, Ousted Titan Keeps a Hold Over Senegal

docs.snippet: Despite a drubbing in the last election, Abdoulaye Wade, the former Senegalese president, remains prominent in national politics, having showered gifts on supporters while in office....
docs.abstract: Dakar Journal; former Senegalese Pres Abdoulaye Wade is still prominent on the national political scene, despite suffering a crushing electoral defeat in March; he continues to have a hold over the people's imagination after so many years in office.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite a drubbing in the last election, Abdoulaye Wade, the former Senegalese president, remains prominent in national politics, having showered gifts on supporters while in office.
